verses.translation: (1) Nūn.[1724] By the pen and what they inscribe,
(2) You are not, [O Muḥammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
(3) And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
(4) And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
(5) So you will see and they will see
(6) Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِٱلۡمُهۡتَدِينَ
verses.translation: (7) Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
(8) Then do not obey the deniers.
(9) They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
(10) And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
(11) [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
(12) A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
(13) Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.[1725]
(14) Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

verses.arabic_text: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: (15) When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
(16) We will brand him upon the snout.[1726]

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا بَلَوۡنَٰهُمۡ كَمَا بَلَوۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ إِذۡ أَقۡسَمُواْ لَيَصۡرِمُنَّهَا مُصۡبِحِينَ
verses.translation: (17) Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
(18) Without making exception.[1727]

verses.arabic_text: فَطَافَ عَلَيۡهَا طَآئِفٞ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمۡ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.translation: (19) So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
(20) And it became as though reaped.
(21) And they called one another at morning,

verses.arabic_text: أَنِ ٱغۡدُواْ عَلَىٰ حَرۡثِكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰرِمِينَ
verses.translation: (22) [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
(23) So they set out, while lowering their voices,

verses.arabic_text: أَن لَّا يَدۡخُلَنَّهَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّسۡكِينٞ
verses.translation: (24) [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
(25) And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.[1728]
(26) But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
(27) Rather, we have been deprived."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ أَوۡسَطُهُمۡ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ لَوۡلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.translation: (28) The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"[1729]

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: (29) They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
(30) Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
(31) They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.

verses.arabic_text: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبۡدِلَنَا خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.translation: (32) Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."[1730]

verses.arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡعَذَابُۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ أَكۡبَرُۚ لَوۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡلَمُونَ
verses.translation: (33) Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: (34) Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
(35) Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
(36) What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
(37) Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
(38) That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

verses.arabic_text: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ أَيۡمَٰنٌ عَلَيۡنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمۡ لَمَا تَحۡكُمُونَ
verses.translation: (39) Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
(40) Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

verses.arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شُرَكَآءُ فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمۡ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: (41) Or do they have partners?[1731] Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُكۡشَفُ عَن سَاقٖ وَيُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ
verses.translation: (42) The Day the shin will be uncovered[1732] and they are invited to prostration but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,

verses.arabic_text: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۖ وَقَدۡ كَانُواْ يُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمۡ سَٰلِمُونَ
verses.translation: (43) Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.[1733]

verses.arabic_text: فَذَرۡنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِۖ سَنَسۡتَدۡرِجُهُم مِّنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
verses.translation: (44) So leave Me, [O Muḥammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān]. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.[1734]
(45) And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

verses.arabic_text: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ
verses.translation: (46) Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
(47) Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

verses.arabic_text: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلۡحُوتِ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكۡظُومٞ
verses.translation: (48) Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad], and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah] when he called out while he was distressed.

verses.arabic_text: لَّوۡلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعۡمَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذۡمُومٞ
verses.translation: (49) If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.[1735]
(50) And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

verses.arabic_text: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَيُزۡلِقُونَكَ بِأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡ لَمَّا سَمِعُواْ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
verses.translation: (51) And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks] when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
(52) But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
